title: Discovery Call - Acme Corporation
meetingRecap:
Great initial conversation!

Had an excellent discovery call with Sarah Mitchell (VP Operations) and David Chen (CTO) from Acme. They're experiencing significant pain points with their current supply chain software:

  • Legacy systems causing integration headaches
  • Lack of real-time visibility into operations
  • Manual processes eating up team time
  • Need for better analytics and reporting

Key Takeaways:

Acme is ready to make a change and has budget allocated ($500K-$1M). They're impressed with our platform's ability to integrate with their existing ERP system. David mentioned they're evaluating 2 other vendors but we seem to be the frontrunner.

Sarah is our champion internally and will help coordinate a broader team demo next week.

nextSteps.action: Schedule technical demo with engineering team
Send product documentation and API specs

title: Partnership Discussion - TechVentures
meetingRecap:
Exciting Partnership Opportunity

Met with Emily Rodriguez (CEO) and Michael Thompson (Head of Product) to explore integration partnership. TechVentures' AI analytics platform could complement our offering perfectly.

Potential Partnership Models Discussed:

  1. Technology Integration: Build native integration between our platforms
  2. Co-Marketing: Joint webinars and case studies
  3. Channel Partnership: Mutual referrals and revenue share

Emily is very excited about option #1 - a deep technical integration. Their engineering team has bandwidth starting Q2 2026.

Business Potential:

  • Access to their 150+ customer base
  • Differentiated offering in market
  • Potential $2M+ in additional revenue

nextSteps.action: Technical teams to discuss integration architecture

title: Product Demo - GlobalHealth Solutions
meetingRecap:
Product Demonstration

Conducted comprehensive platform demo for Dr. Lisa Patel (CMO) and James Wilson (VP Engineering). Focus on healthcare-specific features:

  • HIPAA-compliant data handling
  • Patient data integration
  • Automated reporting for compliance
  • Real-time clinic operations dashboard

Dr. Patel was particularly impressed with the compliance features. James asked detailed technical questions about our security architecture and API capabilities.

Feedback: Very positive. They need to evaluate one more vendor before making decision.

title: Initial Meeting - RetailMax Group
meetingRecap:
First Meeting with RetailMax

Met Amanda Foster (Director of Digital Strategy) and Robert Kim (CIO) at their Chicago HQ. RetailMax is in the middle of a major digital transformation initiative.

Their Situation:

  • 500+ stores nationwide
  • Legacy POS and inventory systems
  • Growing e-commerce but disconnected from stores
  • CEO has mandated digital transformation by Q3 2026

Budget & Timeline:

They have $5M budget allocated for this transformation. Timeline is aggressive - need solution implemented by June 2026.

Amanda is our internal champion. Robert is cautious but open-minded. Both agree our platform addresses their core needs.

nextSteps.action: Schedule technical demo for IT team

title: Technical Deep Dive - FinanceFirst Partners
meetingRecap:
Technical Architecture Discussion

In-depth technical session with Thomas Anderson (Head of Technology) and his engineering team. Covered:

  • System architecture and scalability
  • Security and compliance (SOC 2, financial industry requirements)
  • API capabilities and integration options
  • Data residency and privacy controls
  • Disaster recovery and business continuity

Technical Evaluation:

Thomas and team were impressed with our architecture. They particularly liked:

  • Multi-region deployment options
  • Granular access controls
  • Audit logging capabilities
  • API-first design

Concerns Raised:

They need assurance on our financial services compliance. We'll provide SOC 2 Type II report and schedule call with our security team.

nextSteps.action: Share SOC 2 Type II audit report
Provide API documentation and sandbox access
